private_information: I control the set of actions available in the environment: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.

Action signatures: paltry(object_0, object_1, object_2), sip(object_0, object_1, object_2), clip(object_0, object_1, object_2), wretched(object_0, object_1, object_2, object_3), memory(object_0, object_1, object_2), tightfisted(object_0, object_1, object_2).
For each action there are explicit preconditions and effects expressed over binary predicates such as hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, spring, stupendous, collect.

I know the general precondition and effect patterns described by the use-case but I do not commit to a PDDL encoding. My role is to describe canonical names, types, and the action schemas at an abstract level.
player.goal: Provide canonical schemas for actions and a clean list of object identifiers and predicate names so planners can validate and reference them.

private_information: Initial facts set A: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_10 object_3, collect object_11 object_3, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_12, hand object_13, hand object_14, next object_0 object_6, next object_1 object_9, next object_12 object_11, next object_13 object_6, next object_14 object_8, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_10, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_9, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_10, texture object_11, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Local goal A: next object_12 object_10, next object_13 object_10, next object_14 object_9.

Proposed plan A includes the following ordered actions: wretched object_4 object_7 object_8 object_2, clip object_14 object_4 object_8, wretched object_4 object_8 object_6 object_2, tightfisted object_14 object_4 object_6, sip object_14 object_0 object_6, sip object_13 object_0 object_6, memory object_0 object_6 object_9, paltry object_14 object_0 object_9, paltry object_13 object_0 object_9, wretched object_5 object_10 object_11 object_3, clip object_12 object_5 object_11, wretched object_5 object_11 object_9 object_3, clip object_13 object_5 object_9, wretched object_5 object_9 object_10 object_3, tightfisted object_13 object_5 object_10, tightfisted object_12 object_5 object_10.
planner_a.goal: Validate plan A against the abstract action schemas and produce a structured analysis of which steps are applicable, which preconditions are satisfied by the initial facts, which effects update predicates of interest, and any missing or ambiguous references.

private_information: Initial facts set B: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, hand object_14, next object_0 object_8, next object_11 object_10, next object_12 object_5, next object_13 object_7, next object_14 object_9, next object_3 object_6, next object_4 object_9, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Local goal B: next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_8, next object_13 object_5, next object_14 object_7.
No concrete plan is provided in statement B. Planner B should reason from initial facts and action schemas to propose required steps or identify resource requirements.
planner_b.goal: Analyze initial facts B, identify a minimal set of actions or steps that can achieve local goal B using the available action schemas, and report any assumptions or unresolved precondition dependencies.

private_information: I coordinate analyses from other agents and produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner.
I must integrate the canonical action schemas, both planners analyses, object inventories, initial facts, and the combined goal into a single consistent PDDL domain and problem file.
The final PDDL must preserve distinct agent intentions as separate action schemas if they refer to different roles or object naming.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem that encodes the action schemas, initial facts, object declarations, and the combined goals from planner_a and planner_b, optimized for FastDownwards.

public_information: Objects in the domain are named object_0 through object_14.
Predicates used: hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, spring, stupendous, collect.

Available actions and their informal schemas: paltry(object_0, object_1, object_2) has preconditions hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2 and effects add next object_0 object_2 and delete vase object_0 object_1.

sip(object_0, object_1, object_2) preconditions hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2 and effects add vase object_0 object_1 and delete next object_0 object_2.

clip(object_0, object_1, object_2) preconditions hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2 and effects add vase object_0 object_1 and delete next object_0 object_2.

wretched(object_0, object_1, object_2, object_3) preconditions sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3 and effects add next object_0 object_2 and delete next object_0 object_1.
memory(object_0, object_1, object_2) preconditions cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1 and effects add next object_0 object_2 and delete next object_0 object_1.

tightfisted(object_0, object_1, object_2) preconditions hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1 and effects add next object_0 object_2 and delete vase object_0 object_1.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the abstract domain maintainer. Produce a canonical list of predicates, object names, types, and normalized action schemas without emitting PDDL. Describe each action precondition and effect in a structured enumeration suitable for downstream encoding.

You are Planner A. Using the provided public action schemas and your private initial facts and proposed plan, validate each plan step. For each step, report whether preconditions are satisfied at that point, list the effects that would hold after the step, and identify any missing preconditions or ambiguous object references. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a structured report that can be consumed by an orchestrator.

You are Planner B. Using the provided public action schemas and your private initial facts, propose a minimal sequence of actions to reach your local goal or explain why the goal is currently unreachable. For each proposed action, list required preconditions and predicted effects. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a structured plan or a dependency report for the orchestrator.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the canonical schemas and the structured analyses from the other agents and produce a single PDDL domain file and a single PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownwards planner. The domain must include types, predicates, and clearly named actions corresponding to the six available actions. The problem must declare all objects object_0 through object_14, represent the combined initial facts from planner_a and planner_b that are consistent, and encode the combined goals from both planners. Preserve distinct action names and do not conflate roles. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Ensure the produced PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards requirements.
